name: South Dakota Discovery Center
address: 805 W Sioux Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: We love the Discovery Center! It's a wonderful place for the kids to run around and burn energy, but also filled with educational activities. Keep your eyes open for awesome programming that the staff put on. The hours a little bit shortened in the winter, so if you're unable to make it now, rest assured summer hours are coming!

This place is huge and really neat for kids to explore. There are so many things to do. My kids loved being in a giant bubble and also playing in the house and figuring out how to use the "house phones". We will definitely have to come back next time.
Excellent place for kids. Lots of fun things for kids to do & look at. All age group activities for children. Kids will thank you for the fun.
Such a fun place for children AND adults! Everyone is so nice!!
Nice place with kids activities. The staff was friendly and they have some fun learning things to do!

name: South Dakota State Historical Society
address: 900 Governors Dr, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: An inexpensive museum with great value. A really interesting mostly underground building with a great view of town. Packed with information in the permanent galleries and with two rotating exhibits as well.
Really nice museum, covers from the prehistoric to the current.  The exhibits are well done and informative.  we spent about two hours.  Cost is $4 with discount for seniors and children.
Nice place ,  decent price to get in, very educational with all kinds of things to read about. As a local from the area I was impressed with the amount of extensive coverage on various subjects.
Best small museum I've ever seen. It is a hidden gem in Pierre...spent 3 hours when I'd planned on 45 minutes. By all means, go.

Beautiful scenery! Wonderful wildlife! And lots of places to visit with many things to do for the family. Highly recommend this area in the Black Hills of South Dakota for a vacation, even for a short getaway. It's so worth seeing and experiencing.

name: South Dakota National Guard Museum
address: 301 E Dakota Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Unfortunately when my friend and I rolled in around 5 pm, it had closed by 4 pm. Though I cannot say anything for the content inside, this small property boasts a rich reserve of vehicles and equipment to view outside (pictures included). I would like to go back to see the inside someday.
Nice little museum down by the Missouri River.  The building was closed when I visited, but there were enough outdoor exhibits to make it worth a side trip.

If you are in Pierre SD, this is a small niche museum you must see.  It's simple but done with heart that comes from pride in service to the Nation.  We've come to really appreciate in our travels how much pride the "locals" put into places like this...so, stop by and support this tribute to Americans who served their nation in combat.
If ever in pierre,sd this is a must, very nice and interesting look into not only the history of the SD National Guard, the history of the US military as a whole.

A great little museum to visit if you are visiting Pierre.  It might be recommended for nonresidents to set map directions as it isn't necessarily located in a popular area of travel. 

A great place for people like myself  who enjoy military history and continual learning. I personally enjoyed our visit,  despite not all our children being as excited as I was. Unfortunately generational differences don't necessarily allow this place to be as enjoyable for teenagers. It is definitely recommended for younger children as my grandsons had a wonderful time.

name: South Dakota State Capitol
address: 500 E Capitol Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: My experience here was quite good. My mate and I rolled up in our car and parked just a block away with no issues, and unlike many of the other state capitol buildings I have visited, this had no security checks, at least coming through the door we did. All of the rooms were pretty accessible, including the State Affairs room where I testified. The setting was very nice on a bluff overlooking the Missouri River, and the ponds around it looked very cool. I might not visit again to testify, but I am glad I did the one time. It’s close in resemblance to the Montana State capitol because the same design was used, interestingly enough. If you’re passing through, it’s worth even a quick visit.

It’s a decent state building though there isn’t much to see for tourists besides a few displays on the little history about the building itself and some pictures of the state officials. I wish it would show more culture, politics, and history stuff relating to the state of South Dakota.

Great place. Pierre is such a quiet and simple city. When we visited here the Capitol dome was under repair work. But the experience of being there was superb enough to make us happy. We walked in the nearby areas and took some pictures. The nearby areas are also quiet and not too much traffic and activity there. We liked the atmosphere and our visit to this great location. There’s a church nearby and right in front of the capitol there is a Soldiers and Sailors World War Memorial Building.
Interesting place to wander through, with plenty of artistic and architectural details.  The evening I visited there was a music recital that added to the enjoyment.

Nice building to visit.  We didn't get to spend a lot of time as we were on our way to Rapid City.  We did get the boys capitol books stamped but almost had to run to another location (luckily found someone willing to go behind the desk and get the stamp.

name: Fighting Stallions Memorial
address: 500 E Capitol Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Nice interesting statue dedicated to past governor George s Mickelson and other government officials that died in a plane crash in Iowa years back. Right next to the state Capitol building and capital lake.
Beautiful memorial for Gov. Mickelson and the others lost in 1993. Very picturesque location overlooking Capitol Lake.
Nice park with a walk path around a pond with several statues.
Great piece of art, right by capitol lake.

Can't understand the confusing 1 star reviews here (and no comments either). What's the matter with these people? Along with the WWII monument at Capital Lake, the Fighting Stallions sculpture is easily one of the most moving tributes in all of Pierre/Ft. Pierre.

name: Casey Tibbs Rodeo Center Museum
address: 210 Verendrye Dr, Fort Pierre, SD 57532, USA
reviews: Amazing Rodeo History and A Great Staff!!!
If your into rodeo this is a must. Lots of history within this building.
Great venue with an upstairs meeting room and with kitchen which could be used for a variety of events. Staff are great to work with.
You don't have to be a rodeo fan to enjoy this Museum. Lots of interesting exhibits and excellent photographs Plus Great videos of rodeo Riders. Fully accessible to wheel chairs.
Just a buck'n!

name: Steamboat Park
address: Poplar Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: A must see if you are in the area.
It rained but we enjoined the sights! Peaceful yet being used by fishers, boaters, people on lunch breaks. Paths and pavilions.
Steamboat is a really good place to cool down after a hot day.
Nicely maintained park. Good fishing. Next to the river.
Nice little place to sit down and eat supper. Clean, close to the river, again, just a wonderful place to visit.

name: Oahe Downstream State Recreation Area
address: 20439 Marina Loop, Fort Pierre, SD 57532, USA
reviews: It's so beautiful, and the camping cabins are far more spacious than they look.
A great family location that the kids enjoy going back to often.

Each campground (three total) has at least one fully functional comfort station. The cottonwood trail is amazing for nature watching, walking, or biking. Playgrounds at each campground and another near the marina. By far, one of my favorite campgrounds.

Beautiful place. Paved for most of the area and a great place to relax. The roads are kind of confusing it's really just better to use Google maps or satelite images to get around. Also be ready to get some driving in. There are no places around the area to get snacks or drinks so bring your own.
Great camping and fishing grounds. Lots of trails to explore  as well.

name: Verendrye Monument
address: Verendrye Dr, Fort Pierre, SD 57532, USA
reviews: Beautiful place to get a good sense of history, and a wonderful view of the river and the whole town. Can get good sunsets and sunrise views.
Cool piece of history. Great view!!

I was born and raised in Aberdeen, SD. As a child we made several trips to and through Pierre and Ft. Pierre, and I had the opportunity to see the Verendrye Plate several times. It was exciting to see this historical relic of French explorers and traders in the Dakotas.  My memories of the area at that time also include watching the construction of the Oahe Dam, at that time, the largest rolled earth dam in the world,  across the Missouri River.
Historical monument

name: Fischers Lilly Park
address: 415 Ash Ave, Fort Pierre, SD 57532, USA
reviews:
Great place to stop and rest. 12 RV spots with electricity and water  and dump station .
$15 a night. Worth stopping here.  Beautiful  views of the Missior and Bad rivers.

Affordable, quiet, beautiful view! What I love most about this park is that it is first come first serve. We came just before a holiday and didn't realize it...most of the other parks, with water and electric, were taken and as a last resort we tried this one. Wow we were pleasantly surprised with this park. The view, the play park and riverboat access made our stay here very pleasant. Only thing that was a little bit of an inconvenience was the dump station...no sewage hookups. But for $15 per night I would say this is a bargain.
Beautiful park. Very nice shelter and play ground. Great for dogs. No shore access for dogs
Great open green space right along the river. The playground was nice, but nothing spectacular. The kiddos and us had a great time at the Ft Pierre days!

Nice little RV park on the Missouri River. 
Has water and electric; well maintained.

name: Verendrye Museum
address: Deadwood St, Fort Pierre, SD 57532, USA
reviews: Great place for camping and fishing and visiting with family and friends.

Visited this past summer as we went through Ft. Pierre. On a side street and full of many historical artifacts, lots of history exhibits. The lady there was very happy to tell us about the local history and answer any questions .
Very basic museum, at least it's free.
Nice!

name: Fort Pierre Chouteau National Historic Landmark
address: 348-350 Fort Chouteau Rd, Fort Pierre, SD 57532, USA
reviews:
It is an acreage dedicated to preserving the history of one of largest trading posts on the upper Missouri. Of note, it is the starting point of George Catlin's paintings of the North American Indian. He resolved that “nothing short of the loss of my life, shall prevent me from visiting their country, and of becoming their historian.”  
As of fall 2017 an over look was built to give the visitor a higher vantage point to look over the historic sight.
Historical landmark well documented at this site
Very cool my ancestors worked there so it was nice to put a place to my genealogy research
The oldest settlement in the Dakota Territory. The Fort Pierre area has been continuously occupied since 1817.

name: Farm Island
address: Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Wonderful State Park, beautifully maintained. Sites are large and grassy. Few mature trees in the Eastern end, but was still very nice. Great views of the surrounding hills. Nature walks, bike paths, fishing and swimming in the river. Oh did I mention that the bathrooms and showers were awesome and sparkling clean. Certainly nothing bad to say! Friendly people too!
Great for camping, swimming, kayaking, running/walking, bicycling, and so much more. Awesome place to take your family. Staff is always super helpful and kind.
There is so much to love about this area. Quiet. Tranquil. Relaxing.
New shower houses and restrooms in 2019 clean campgrounds was a great time!
Rating is for a visit a few months ago. We were just visiting the area and the woman working there was very helpful in getting us information.

name: VisionBedding
address: 512 S Van Buren Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: I ordered 2 rugs with matching curtains. They are amazing! Well made and beautiful. I want to add that the customer service is wonderful as well! I had an issue with the Postal delivery, and Vision Bedding was ready to fix the issue if the Post Office didn't. Thankfully, my package was recovered, but, the fact that they would help out is rare for companies. I highly recommend, and will be ordering more items to complete my set. Thanks all!

We are in the beginning process of having one of our rooms dedicated to our favorite vacation spot, Wildwood, New Jersey.  We want this room to be filled with special memories of Wildwood.  After some research, I found Vision Bedding on the internet and decided to upload one of my husband's pictures for curtains.  They turned out beautiful.  We are so happy.  The company was in contact via email during the process to make sure we were happy with the placement and look before going to print.  We received our curtains in about a week and hung them as soon as they came in.  I would recommend VisionBedding if you are going for that special look.

I ordered a rug and two pillows. I just received the pillows and the rug will be arriving shortly. I was accidently sent the wrong rug, but after an email exchange the situation was rectified the same day. The pillows I received are beautiful and high quality. I was also very pleased with the service I received. What I found most  enjoyable was the selection of products and art that was available. Great job guys.

My daughter wanted Orca whales for her nursery theme, not a common theme. I found vision bedding on line. They were very helpful. The graphic designer Abby was extremely patient and was very helpful. Their   online help line is excellent. They answered in a timely manner. The rug and the pillow were more than I expected . They are beautiful.They were shipped in a timely manner.  Again i could not have done it without  Abby's total guidance.I will certainly use this company again.

Everything about ordering and receiving a comforter from VisionBedding was easy. I was looking for a specific design style and found more to choose from at VisionBedding than any other site online. When my order arrived I was so happy with the craftsmanship and the design was really vibrant, just what I had wanted. To have a handmade comforter of really quality materials was such a great find. Also super nice customer care. I loved everything about this experience!

name: Flaming Fountain Memorial
address: 700 E Broadway Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: If your in Pierre SD, a must to see, better at dark to see the flame. Also fun to feed the ducks and geese.
Nice place to visit.  Be sure to also see the nearby South Dakota capital building at the same time!
Nice memorial. Fountain hasn't been flaming lately, though.
Must see
Love this place

name: Fort Pierre National Grassland
address: Fort Pierre, SD 57532, USA
reviews: Very beautiful place. Lots of farming going on here so if you plan on doing some prairie dog shooting make sure you don't hit any of the farmers cattle.

I lived in the area for twenty plus years. If you are viewing this grassland from the highway only you are catching a glimpse of it.  If you want to really see or experience it , visit the Ft Pierre Nat'l Grasslands Center in Ft Pierre, get a map and advice. During the spring you can reserve a blind to watch and photograph Sharp Tail Grouse. The best thing about the Grasslands is that it is not full of public convences - nor should it be. I have enjoyed this land that was made for skies, and that you can get far enough away from modern life to hear nature unadulterated. Other wildlife seen here are the Pronghorn, deer, butterflies, various hawks, meadowlarks  and snakes- incl rattlesnakes. If you explore in the summer dress correctly and bring plenty of water.
Beautiful Grassland! Got to fish for bass in some of the ponds here. Great fishing and pretty scenery.
Very scenic, but not sure why this is called a National Grassland. Lots of cows grazing in pastures, crops, and haying going on.
piu o meno bella

name: Pioneer Auto Museum
address: 503 5th St, Murdo, SD 57559, USA
reviews: Visiting Pioneer Auto was one of the greatest experiences of my life! I am from Tampa, Florida, and I plan on visiting again! Pioneer Auto is so unique and cool, you will be amazed at the entire collection!

Very nice auto collection that spans many years.  The people working here are very friendly and helpful. You can find most American made antique autos as well as many foreign cars.  The H-D & Indians make up a small display of older motorcycles.  Plus, farm tractors and trucks fill in blanks with a nice collection.  The antiques are nice to see.   Many household items, etc...  Clean restrooms too.  Great place to visit.

This is another one of those places that has been a around for years. The two ladies that were working there were very pleasant. If you love cars, this is the place for you. Extensive car exhibit, tractors, and motorcycles. Only complaint would be to have better lighting in the buildings.

#1 VISIT      WORTH THE VISIT     INSANE AMAZING COLLECTION     GREAT ICE CREAM

Expect to spend an hour or 2 here to see all the buildings and each collections. Everything is so perfectly set up and organized and maintained. The staff was very friendly and if you're lucky you will get a custom tour narration as well. Pretty cool. 

The collection is overwhelmingly large and amazing. So much to see. Totally worth the money. 

Don't forget Ice cream from the Diner on your way out.

This is one of the most AWESOME places I have EVER been! There is something here for everyone! Some of the friendliest folks you ever want to meet, and they let me sit in the Dodge Viper!!!! OH YEAH! Thank you guys so much for a most wonderful visit. My wife, Mom and Dad all had a really great time!

name: West Bend State Recreation Area
address: 22154 Westbend Rd, Harrold, SD 57536, USA
reviews: Great place to visit. It's very remote and you feel like you are in the middle of now where which makes it feel like real camping. Everyone was very friendly and informative. While we were there the rangers/camp hosts would frequently stop by to let us know if bad weather was on it's way and if we needed anything.
Used to be our favorite place.  Now it's too crowded, hard to get reservations.
Great place very clean and well-kept the  people are really friendly and helpful.  this is the kind of place you don't want to tell everyone about,  so you can keep it to your self.
Beautiful location. Clean. If you love boating or fishing this is the place. No swimming beach, which is too bad.
Our favorite fishing "hideaway! Kid friendly, great fishing, nice sized pads. I caught a tagged walleye there!

name: Hyde Baseball Stadium
address: Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Great place. Well maintained
A nice walk around the the Ball Park
Nice overall, but seating is very uncomfortable.
What a great place to watch a game!
Clean, well kept stadium, Pierre Trappers game was fun!

name: Akta Lakota Museum & Cultural Center
address: 1301 N Main St, Chamberlain, SD 57325, USA
reviews: We drove through the campus of St. Joseph's Indian School in Chamberlain and decided to make a quick stop at the Lakota Museum. It turned out to be not so quick. Way more than we expected. A high quality museum with a lot of excellent history of the Lakota Sioux. It also includes a nice summery of St. Joseph's School with many historic photographs. It has an excellent gift shop and the young ladies working in the gift shop were friendly and helpful. The museum is not large so an hour would work but if you have more time and are interested in history this would be a good place to target. A beautiful setting on the Missouri river.

Quite small, but an excellent museum. Clean and clear ehxibit. Plenty of nice souvenirs to remember the history of the Great Plains people. If you're passing nearby it worth the stop to visit it. If , like us, you are in a family vacation trip across the Plains, it is worth too. Those who have read Bury My Heart at Wounded Knee will be specially pleased.

On our way to the Badlands/Black Hills we enjoyed stopping at Chamberlain to see the view of the Missouri River from the Visitor Center.   Fortunately, we made time on our way back to stop at this lovely museum.  The museum is a beautiful building right on the river in town.  There is a friendly staff and the exhibits were very well done.  For families this should be a must see on the way to other sites in South Dakota - especially for families who are trying to help their children understand the history of this area.   While Mount Rushmore is a destination for many, this museum helps provide some balance.  Thank you for investing your time and money in educating people about our past.

So honored to be able to go to a unique place. Learning history that mainstream Education system didn't teach you in schools.  The medicine wheel courtyard was so peaceful.  So many beautiful works of art from former students of the school. So much to take in that one visit is not enough.

Every South Dakota school child should be required to visit here; as well as every adult!  I learned SO much.  Very detailed exhibits and notations on early Native American Life, culture.  Lots of authentic items, donated & identified.  There is a very large bookstore, souvenir shop; with something or everyone.  I spent 2 1/2 hrs here.  Native staff who work here are a wonderful source of current & historical information on our native Americans.

name: West Whitlock State Recreation Area
address: 16157 W Whitlock Rd # A, Gettysburg, SD 57442, USA
reviews: My family and I try to make it out to West Whitlock at least once per year.  We are rarely disappointed and this year was no different.  Beautiful park, clean comfort stations, friendly staff and guests.  Strongly recommend.
Great place, clean and awesome service.

We stayed late in the season it was convenient and clean but the rate seemed a little high when all the bathrooms and water were off. Maybe the gf&p could look at a off-peak season rate. We would use the cabins often for ice fishing or hunting if they did!
Nice facilities. Great for family outings and boat fishing. Very quiet and relaxing.

Couldn't find anything to complain about. They weren't very busy when we were there (late August) so it was very peacefull. We were late getting there and thought we were to late to get some firewood but the host drove through about 9 and went and got us some.

The only thing some might have problems with is that if you have ATT, you will have 0 signal. That was ok with us because we were looking to get off the grid for a bit.

Very nice and relaxing stay! Will go again!

name: Big Badlands Overlook
address: Interior, SD 57750, USA
reviews: This area is massive and breathtaking. I don't think pictures do it justice, you definitely have to be there to experience it yourself. The ridges go on for miles, and the sense of scale is amazing! I'd go again in a heartbeat.

It was amazing. Totally worth the $25. You are able to see beautiful nature along with some different animals such as rattlesnakes, big horned sheep, and bison. You are able to climb and hike! It's an amazing experience!
Wow! What an awesome place to visit! The views are outstanding! There are plenty of places to pull off and enjoy the beauty as well as some great hiking trails!

A nice visitor with lots of information about the Badlands. It is small and there were a lot of people in there on the day we stopped. They have a nice selection of gift items as well a books about the area. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Awesome place to spend the day at. Lots of good trails to hike and plenty of good overlooks that you can just drive right up to. They have a great visitor center with souvenirs and any additional information you may need on the park.

name: Badlands National Park
address: South Dakota, USA
reviews: A very beautiful place to stop with many places within it that you'll just have to take pictures. Parents.... watch your children. There are many places that are not fenced and seriously unsafe. This is also part of the beauty as you can touch, walk into the natural areas. Some decent places to stop and eat, buy trinkets and piddle. Decently clean in most places.

Photos of the Badlands are awesome.... but actually being here and seeing it with your own eyes is truly amazing, especially in the morning. Luckily all the wildlife were cooperating the day we visited and were out and about.

I arrived at the Badlands relatively late in the day, around 8:00pm or even later. It was the middle of the summer, and we got out of our car just in time to see one of the most beautiful sunsets I have ever seen. We proceeded to drive through the park until dark, and from what I witnessed, the badlands looks like an amazing place to visit during the day time, especially if one has more than an hour as they are passing through.
We visited in winter and with the slight snow dusting this landscape was astonishing. Would recommend anyone to visit it. The visitor center is great and has friendly and informative staff.

Amazing scenery and drives inside and outside this jewel of a park. Colors in the hills are unique and amazing. I am planning on going back, there was not enough time to see everything. But I did go to Wall Drug. I suggest stopping there at least once in your life.

name: Pinnacles Overlook
address: SD-240, Wall, SD 57790, USA
reviews: Simply breathtaking scenic view out Gods Land! Parking was plentiful and restrooms were convenient. Please keep the area clean and use the trash cans!!
Simply beautiful 😍😍😍 The view is amazing even if it's a cloudy day
The Pinnacles Overlook has nice RV parking and some awesome photographic opportunities. Worth the brief stop during your road trip through the Badlands.
We explored all area on misty foggy day. The water made the colors more vibrant. As we came back up from overlook entire place was in a cloud. So surreal.

Ample parking and plenty of people space also at this first overlook as you head into the park from Wall, SD.  We stopped a few times and each time there was also wildlife either in the immediate area or down in the canyon.  Great place for sunset.

name: Yellow Mounds Overlook
address: SD-240, Wall, SD 57790, USA
reviews: The variety of color was very beautiful! Short and steep hike is awesome. You can see bighorn sheep trails. Its a good place to kiss also!
Just breathtaking views and beautiful formations.
This is a beautiful location. But you need to go deep and camp to truly enjoy the nature. But it's not as beautiful as Grand canyon.
By the time we made it here, everyone else was "done" so I was the only one to get out and explore a bit.  A little change up in the coloring 😁
Definitely need to stop here! Go down and take a first hand look of the yellow mounds.

name: South Dakota Hall of Fame
address: 1480 S Main St, Chamberlain, SD 57325, USA
reviews: Nice walk to see the trucks and monuments
We came  across this  place while we were searching for gas station. Nice views out side the building and cool plane model to look at. Didn’t go inside as it was closed.
Great facility to visit.  Would always visit and stretch my legs traveling through the area.
If you stop,  pay your respects ...
Monumental place to visit! Very nice

name: LaFramboise Island State Nature Area
address: LaFramboise Island Trail, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: A great place to walk or let the dogs run anytime of the year! We especially love coming here late fall/winter as there is no leash requirement then. The trails are always well kept and clean

If you are from out of town and are in the Pierre area go to this island! Full of nature and great trails in the middle of the Missouri. Deer everywhere. My family and I really enjoyed taking Sunday strolls through the thick woods.
Camping. What camping? Decent camping. Or parking.
Very quiet place to sit
Love my little island

name: Skeleton Man Walking Skeleton Dinosaur
address: On the westbound side of I-90, just before exit 170., I-90, Midland, SD 57552, USA
reviews:
We seen this on our Yellow Stone road trip. This was awesome along the highway to see.
Make sure  you watch for it...
Very cool! Enjoyed seeing it from the road when we drove by!
Unique roadside attraction. Just snap a pic driving by or pull over if ya want, but not everyday do you see a TRex out for a walk with one of the locals.
One of the things that makes America great - public art.  This is a really cool thing to see on the side of the road.  Tell your kids to look North around Belvidere, SD.
Need to pull off the side of I-90 West

name: Minuteman Missile Visitors Center
address: 24545 CottonWood Rd, Philip, SD 57567, USA
reviews: Staffs were friendly and give the information about the roads & it's conditions. Well maintained place, must visit. Before visiting Badlands national Park, check the road conditions here. Or another visitors center ( Ben Reifel visitors center) is on Hwy 240.

I didn't think I would like this, but loved it.  Lots of cool interactive displays and photos. The video they play in the theatre about the cold war is very interesting.  Did not know that a Russian man saved the world on September  26,1983. We should all be forever grateful to Stanislav Petrov.

My sons loved this stop!  Plenty to see and interact with.  We stopped at the other site as well which allowed us to see the missile but we couldn't participate in the tour because my oldest is very afraid of heights.  We still spent a lot of time here exploring and learning.  It was a wonderful place to visit!
Very cool place I wish I would have had more time as we got here about 15 minutes before closing. Will definitely visit again when we're in this part of the country
Minuteman Missile Visitors Center is an interesting attraction but the Minuteman Missile bunker tour was way cool!  You get to see the conditions and walk through an actual launch center.

name: St Charles Lounge
address: 207 E Capitol Ave #109, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: A great place to sit and have a coffee martini on the occasion my girls get together for drinks. Beautiful job. Modern, yet rustic atmosphere. Good music options. Drinks are fun and relevant. I see their specials posted a lot and reminds me of the bar I ran back home in Oregon. This place was FINALLY a fun little bar for the 20-30 somethings in Pierre to go without a bunch of yucky drunks and drama. Dig it.
The large clear ice balls are perfect with a top shelf whiskey. The signature cocktails are a must have. I have a few more to try, but so for the Mai Tai and the Cucumber Collins are my favorite.
Great atmosphere. Looked like great spirits selection. I enjoyed the beer instead which was also a very good selection! Wish I had found this place sooner.
A great place for a drink. History of town. The bartender pour a good drink.
Super beautiful remodeling. Drinks are specially crafted but worth the wait. Comfortable and accommodating atmosphere in one of Pierre's oldest buildings.

name: Mount Rushmore National Memorial
address: 13000 SD-244, Keystone, SD 57751, USA
reviews: Great Bucket List Item to check off the list. Overall it was pretty straight forward, the "easy", more family friendly path was under construction however there was still space and opportunity for good pics. I can say that the bathroom facilities left something to be desired, I'll spare the details. It wasn't a cleanliness issue it was more of a structural issue, I mind you I'm 6ft 380lbs so this may be an isolated complaint.

Well my mom & made the trip! She flew from Maryland to Missouri to meet me and we took a road trip. Yes Good ole fashion road trip. And hands down folks it was wonderful!!!!  The towns all around are so quaint and sweet. People are very kind and helpful. If its not on your bucket list... It sure should be!!!!

What a wonderful place.  
Truly a sight to behold. 
Not at all what I had expected. 
Clean, accessible, organized layout with outstanding customer service from all personnel working on site.  
Each person took the time to greet you and make you feel welcome.  
I expected a tourist attraction, however I was given a real sense of belonging to the site. The history and the deeper meanings were shared. And the origin story of the creation was really great.

I've been visiting my whole life. I can't believe how much it is built up. This trip was one of the best. Over Christmas Keystone and Mount Rushmore was a ghost town all to ourselves. My daughter first time and she was in awe. Definitely a must see much better if you don't have to fight a crowd.

Incredibly amazing experience. Just to see the memorial in its full glory was astounding! It’s truly breathtaking and I’m truly sad that people don’t understand the hard work and meaning that goes into this. The thought that went into this is truly incredible! Great vacation idea!

name: Custer State Park
address: 13400 US, US-16A, Custer, SD 57730, USA
reviews: Outstanding! Huge, beautiful state park one of my favorite to camp and spend days exploring the park with nights filled with stars.  Saw many bison.  We rented one of their cabins, no complaints would be ideal if some were pet friendly.  Very easy drive into Deadwood for an afternoon of eating, drinking and checking out the sights.  Looking forward to another visit to spend more time so we can see all of this magnificent park. Good facilities, sites are well proportioned, Rangers very helpful and easy to find.

We truly enjoyed Custer Park. We got there around 10 am and found it hard to see much of the wildlife around that time, so best to probably go earlier as others recommend. We were lucky enough to see some buffalo closer towards her end but overall there were some very nice views. The folks at the visitor center were extremely helpful and truly provided great recommendations. We were aiming to go from Custer park to Crazy Horse and then Mt. Rushmore however were advised to take a different route and it was worth it. We got to see Mt. Rushmore as we were going though a tunnel. Recommend doing a visit.

Not what you would expect for a leisurely afternoon drive.  The park has more to offer than buffalo and open plains. Quaint camping lodging tucked away around one bend. Gentle babbling brooks around the next bend.  Wild donkeys greet you at the next turn. And buffalo are virtually everywhere.  
Don’t speed through this one. 
Take your time and really take in this place. 
It’s still a land lost in the late 1800’s and you can feel the history.  
Highly recommended this visit. 
On a last high note. The cost for the park was super reasonable for a day trip

Beautiful area. Driving the switchback narrow roads around the Needles formations is worth the price of admission itself. Sylvan lake is amazing and we also did a few trails around the area. All are great but we really enjoy the hike up Little Devil's Tower mountain. Fun trail with lots of raspberry bushes along most of it. Last half mile is exposed with a little bit of non technical rock climbing at the end makes it a fun adventure.

Oh man this place is top notch. Lots of hiking great hiking trail.try the Sunday gluch trail . Great Mountain View. Very busy in summer time. If you are planing on camping there place booked ahead of time. $20 park admission free..

name: Snake Creek Recreation Area
address: 35316 SD-44, Platte, SD 57369, USA
reviews: Very peaceful campground near the Missouri River. East campground has paved parking pass and clean shower house/bathrooms. Hiking trails, boat ramp, beach, and playground close to the camp sites. West campground has gravel pads and some seem steep. Great spot to relax for a few days. Did notice planes flying over often, perhaps from Sioux Falls to Denver?

This is probably one of my favorite sites that i've stayed in so far. We had a site right next to the Missouri river with views to die for. The water was less than 10 feet away. The view was incredible, also, no mosquitos ! For the first time in a long time we could actually enjoy an evening outside without using bug spray. (Been road tripping on the east coast) I would say that this site is definitely more of an RV site than it is for tent/van campers, there's loads of outdoor sports like jet skiing and whatnot that go on around and it seems to be a popular spot for the local residents and families in the area. They had great showers and amenities which made it a nice stay and the campsite was generally really nice. Would recommend it for the views. The only negative aspect was that we were charged a fee to enter the state park on top of the camp fee which was a bit steep, and weren't aware of this fee till after we arrived. Seems to be geared more to people who would go to the park often or the state parks often. Other than that it's a lovely campsite and i enjoyed my stay there.
Loved our stay and will visit frequently.

One of our favorite parks, two camp grounds to camp in. Kept up well, sites and comfort stations always clean. What a view, beautiful tree packed bluffs on the west side of the river. Lots of water, the river is about a mile wide and 65' deep.
Great area ,very well taken care of, beautiful.

name: Wylie Park
address: US-281, Aberdeen, SD 57401, USA
reviews: Really enjoyed myself during a visit to Aberdeen, SD. There are so many things to do within the park area. Storybook Land is great for the kids and is kept up very well. I believe the upkeep comes from donations so entry into the park is free! Just a short drive within the park area is entertainment such as miniature golf and go karts for a price. Both offered great fun as I was there with other adults. Definitely would return next time if I'm ever in Aberdeen, SD.
There is so much to do here! We go a couple times a year with our kids and they love it.

Hours of fun.  Wasn't to busy while we were there so was very enjoyable as a family especially since the kids did very little standing in line for the go cars!.  The goose poo along the beach made it kind of icky but swimming was free and fun for all ages.  The bikes were fun, the mini golf was neat and well kept and fun for the while family.   Lots to do with the family or as a larger group!

Such a fun park! I've been going there since I was a child, now my children enjoy it. They continue to make improvements and add new exciting rides and attractions! Their campgrounds, although never personally used them, look great!
Fun for family of all ages. Fair pricing on rentals of bikes single and tandem. Fun mini golf and go carts right next to Storybook Land. Nice clean park

name: Reptile Gardens
address: 8955 US-16, Rapid City, SD 57702, USA
reviews: We took a family of nine (aged 13 - 75) here on a Tuesday and had a great time. The open aviary and the crocodile and alligator enclosures were the best part of the establishment in my opinion. We also had the good fortune to watch a snake show, and then later a bird show (hawk, eagle, owls)-both were well presented well and interesting. There are A LOT of snakes here!oh yes: there are also some Galapagos tortoises, one is 115 years old. Nice place!

Great place to visit if you are into the slithery sort. It's awesome that they give a military discount and parking is always plentiful. Being able to get a season pass from March to November is great. The handlers are entertaining. Make sure you visit during the summer season so you can catch the gator shows.

They will convert your ticket into a season pass for free! The grounds are an easy walk, plenty of opportunities to sit and relax and enjoy the scenery. The reptiles, birds, exotic plants, arachnids and prairie dogs are plentiful and interesting. Playground equipment for littles and gardens for elders. The staff are knowledgeable and helpful. Wonderful way to spend time.

This place was amazing! Every species there was in such great health, it was just a really great experience! They were all very friendly and made the experience very unique! The bird show was incredible! I won't say anything more than that, because I feel that you should experience it yourself if you have the chance! I will return some day!
Lots of really cool animals to look at. It's has more than just reptiles. The gift shop is really neat too. Defitely recommend.

name: Bear Country USA
address: 13820 US-16, Rapid City, SD 57702, USA
reviews: We decided to stop here after visiting Mount Rushmore and didn't know what to expect. I have to say that we were all surprised and just how amazing this place was. We stopped at a gas station and cleaned all the car windows and enjoyed every minute of the drive through Bear Country. The animals get so close to the cars and it's so cool to see them in a more natural environment. There were so many bears to look at, we could've sat in the car all day watching them. Definitely recommend this place!

One of the highlights of visiting WY – dare I say it but it was more impressive and fun than Mount Rushmore!  It is an 11 mile nature preserve that allows you to drive through an assortment of wildlife that will include bears, wolves, mountain goats, etc.  At the end you can leave the car walk through exhibits that more closely resemble a typical zoo.

Definitely worth visiting!

Me and my family loved it. The kids enjoyed getting to see the animals walk around close to the vehicle. Kind of a bummer that we couldn't see the wolf or the big cats because they were sleeping. All in all a good experience. Also enjoyed the walk at the end where your able to see even more animals. Definitely worth the money.

Preponderance of bears roaming. Quite fun. Mountain lions didn't have enough space. Real reindeer herd was cool. Mountain goats and bighorn sheep wandering freely were nice to see. Arctic wolves didn't appear to have much roaming room.

This is a must see attraction for anyone visiting the Black Hills.  A drive through experience with bears and a dozen or so other species of wild life; a walk around area for some up close views of bear cubs and other smaller animals; and the obligatory gift shop that isn't too ridiculously overpriced.  I grew up in the Black Hills and we go back every year or two to visit family and this is one stop that is still a must every time we go back.

name: Storybook Land
address: 2300 24th Ave NW, Aberdeen, SD 57401, USA
reviews: Cute park with multiple themed playgrounds. Nice walking paths with displays from many classic stories. It has an entire section depicting The Wizard of Oz. There is a very large castle in the center of the park. During peak season there are rides available.
So much fun.. I was there as a kid.. There on my wife's and mine early dates.. And now 5 kids later.. even the 17 yr old loves it as much as the 2 year old
It's a inexpensive good time to take your little people and bring back the wonders of your childhood. I've been bringing my kids there now I bring my grandchildren there. And we all love it.

Hours of fun.  Storybook Land is a unique park with tons of interactive figures from your favorite childhood storybook.  Everything is very well kept and they have even added several new attractions since we were here several years ago.  This park is free except for the rides but even those are not to expensive.   Kids got to see figures like Jack and the Bean stalk, Cinderella, Wizard of Oz, Black Stallion, Old McDonald, Winnie the Pooh, 3 Little Pigs and so many more.  They even have a small wild animal exhibit, bike trails and a small train ride that take you around the park.  The train and the newer roller coaster was a favorite for the kids.  Well worth your time!
So much fun! Hard to believe that SD creates and maintains this park for free! Some attractions require tickets, but 90% of it is completely free and fantastic.

name: Dacotah Prairie Museum
address: 21 S Main St, Aberdeen, SD 57401, USA
reviews: Fantastic place to bring kids! Exhibits are well-kept and staff are friendly. Just enough to look at to keep kids entertained!
Very friendly staff and fun exhibits!

I just love going back in History at the Museum! Every time I walk through the DPM, I  learn something new! If you're looking for something to do, check out The Dacotah Prairie Museum! You won't be sorry you did!
It's actually three story tall Museum quite a bit to look at neat place to check out things
Great place for kids and families!

name: Needles Eye Tunnel
address: MP 31, SD-87, Custer, SD 57730, USA
reviews: This was a lot of fun and wish we had do e it the first day in the  Black Hills. $20 pass is good for 7 days and we would have taken advantage of more hiking etc. Rock formations are beautiful and there is plenty of wildlife along the hwy. Other drivers forget other people use the road and cause issues by tunnels, jam on brakes, or swerve across the road without warning so obey the speed signs
The Granite formations here are beautiful. There are Bison roaming the woods and the surrounding Custer State Park is amazing.
Amazing scenery.  Tunnels you hust have to experience.  Loved it.
One of the coolest scenic routes I've been on. Photos don't do it justice. I only wish there was a mirror or something on either side of the tunnel so you could see if vehicles were approaching.
If you can go there, do! The views are breathtaking! My photos don't even touch the full beauty!

name: The World's Only Corn Palace
address: 604 N Main St, Mitchell, SD 57301, USA
reviews: A friend of my wife's had told her about the Corn Palace and since we were driving right past Mitchell we decided to stop by. We expected it to be close to the interstate, which it is not, little did we know that it was here long before anyone had imagined an interstate highway system. It is probably a couple of miles from the highway but there are plenty of signs and it is not hard to find. Parking was also easy with free parking lots within easy walking distance - a couple of blocks. Inside it was a little wacky, a little educational, a lot of history and all very interesting. The people working were friendly and helpful. There was an excellent gift shop and really nice restrooms. Absolutely worth the stop...

The corn palace was everything you needed it to be and nothing you expected. Beautiful murals, that change yearly, made of corn all over the exterior of the palace. Easily spotted with the decorative turrets atop the place. Also home to a rather large basketball arena, the place is genuinely surprising. Across the street you will find the gift shop which honestly is just as enjoyable as the palace itself, definitely a pit stop you should make!

It was so neat!!! The best part was that it was PET FRIENDLY!!! What other place gives you a stop on a long journey and allows your four legged family inside?! We really enjoyed stopping by. You don’t need a long time there but it’s definitely neat to see and support local history spots. After all.l, it’s the world’s only corn palace!!!

We go to watch Dakota Wesleyan's basketball teams. Very nice venue. Most of the parents and faculty sit on the east side which has bleachers but there are padded seats on the west side they're often filled as well. Local groups to halftime entertainment. There's a good snack bar & plenty of bathrooms. The only bad thing is that parking can be an issue. You often have to walk a block or two.

A must stop if you are on highway I90 going by Mitchell. Detail of corn on outside of building is amazing. Inside has merchandise you can buy. A few minutes of off the highway but worth the 5 minute drive.

name: South Dakota Air and Space Museum
address: 2890 Davis Dr, Ellsworth AFB, SD 57706, USA
reviews:
Home of the bomber wing this is a must see. 
Take the family for the free tours and take in the aviation history and marvel in the splendid of the old and new aircraft on display. 
See how the minute men lived and how the name came to pass. Jump into the cockpit of a bomber and feel like you are there at 30,000 ft.  And then slide into the flight simulator and pilot a jet from takeoff to landing ( if you got the “Right Stuff”). 
We were lucky to be outside when the air wing was coming in for landing.  What a wonderful sight to behold.  

Great site to visit for all ages.    And wonderful gift shop with amazing take home items.  
Add this to your list

A wonderful stop I would recommend to anyone traveling in the area. Real decommissioned aircrafts that will leave you in awe. The inside of the museum is definitely interesting as well, and there is no cost to enter.
It's exciting to see all the different aircraft up close and learn a bit about each of them! The staff is also very friendly and helpful! Definitely visit when you're in the area!
Really enjoyed all the exhibits outdoor and indoor. This is really a must see when we have company. Enjoyed the film they had on the place women pilots played during the war!!

Very interesting things to read about. There was a pilot named Clyde Ice and among many things he was a flight instructor. The interesting part is how he was the flight instructor for other aviators that went on to do something significant in aviation. He is mentioned in a few other bios and in the video that is shared there. Plus they got cool planes.

name: Wall Drug Store
address: 510 Main St, Wall, SD 57790, USA
reviews:
My family thought I was nuts, but I had to do it. I remember Wall Drug billboards as a kid in the late 50s and early 60s - from hundreds of miles away, they'd give "distance to Wall Drug". What is it? A tourist trap and one of the greatest marketing campaigns ever.

But seriously, it's much fun to visit. The homemade donuts are to die for. The restaurant is reasonably priced and the food is very good. After that - shop. It actually is a great place to pick up tourist stuff, gifts, etc. And it's a real piece of Americana.

We were on the way to Black Hills and heading into Badlands. It was ever so slightly out of our way and worth the stop. Family still thinks I'm nuts, but they had fun

We enjoined seeing all of the signs as we drove across the state. It was a interesting rest stop on our road trip to Yellowstone from Dunbar PA.
There was a lot to see here. The food here looked very good but it was so busy and we didn't have the time to wait that long to eat.
But we did find several souvenirs to take home and we got our Free Ice Water.....
We'll stop again someday when we have more time  and look it over a lot better....

Wall drug is a must stop if you are traveling through  South Dakota in the I90. You cant miss it with all the billboards they have filled through the highway. They still have the free ice water and cheap coffee tradition, the food was considerably good. And the badlands national park is very closely as well.

Honestly not that impressed. If you want to look around in the shops then it’s a good idea. They have some very interesting shops but there are just so many people and their “famous water” is warm and disgusting. I wish I could rate it higher but it just wasn’t interesting for my whole family.

All those billboards on the road make you expect something special. It’s more like an ordinary tourist attraction full of different staff. Its Wild West theme is quite interesting. It’s the only place to eat in the area but it definitely is overestimated.

name: Falls Park
address: 131 E Falls Park Dr, Sioux Falls, SD 57104, USA
reviews: While a brisk walk on a chilly day would highly recommend parking at the falls and walking the sidewalk and getting out onto the natural stone.  What a nice waterway with an old train track overhead and planes landing a few miles away.  Add the historic old brick mills and sound of the water flow and a nice view of the falls.  Could spend an hour there walking up/down the river walkways.

Was so cold when we went! But, the view of the falls was really pretty and only a short walk from the parking lot. Plus, there was no fee to enter so definitely worth the visit if you're in the area. The Cafe was closed for the season, so can't speak for that. Will try to upload some pics once I get them from my camera, but there are plenty of pics that others posted that pretty much sum it up view wise.

It's a great park to walk through and has lots of places you can sit to enjoy the scenery. During Christmas they set up festive lights, so it's always nice to come see that.
The overlook tower is really fun to go up on because you get a really good view of downtown Sioux Falls. 
The only thing that can be a little off-putting is that the water/falls are very green. It would be really cool if the city could find a solution to purify the water. I realize this wouldn't be an easy or cheap thing to do, but it would definitely brighten up the park!

Nice to visit. Great picnic spot and trails to walk, run and bike. Can smell fishy sometimes and no railings which can make it dangerous if you dont use discretion. Natures beauty and normally pretty popular with locals and tourists so people are around. Neat landmark in Sioux Falls. The light show/history of the falls is a must.

Falls park at around the holidays is truly spectacular.  You can drive around or stop to walk around. All of the lights was amazing and they are enjoyed by young and old alike. Definitely worth a trip.

name: Mitchell Prehistoric Indian Village
address: 3200 Indian Village Rd, Mitchell, SD 57301, USA
reviews: this is a pretty spectacular working archaeological dig that allows folks to come in and actually dig in a climate-controlled environment it's pretty nice it's worth coming to see. the views are beautiful of Lake Mitchell. guides are pretty knowledgeable, they have done a tremendous amount of work and the exhibits for kids are all hands on and that is very cool.

Small site...  lots of parking. Small path to walk on to get there..  not sure if its handicapped accessible, small area for kids to dig for bones and artifacts..  pretty cool though that you could see workers digging and looking for artifacts.. small gift shop..  gift shop was a little pricey
Very cool to see a living archeological site. The grids, what they have found, what will be found, just mesmerizing

Fun experience. Our host was knowledgeable and seemed to really love sharing the story of the original caretakers of this land. We were able to meet and talk to the lead archeologist Dr. Adrian Hannus. My son was start struck! What amazing work they do here! Please consider supporting this site. We can learn so much from researching the past.

Such an interesting place to visit. I had no idea that there is an active archaeological dig site here. Better yet. .....they built a dome over the site to protect it from the elements and to allow visitors to enjoy it.

name: The Mammoth Site
address: 1800 US-18 BYP, Hot Springs, SD 57747, USA
reviews:
This place is awesome. My youngest daughter told her grandparents about it, almost exactly verbatim from what the tour guide said. She decided she was going to be a "digger" right then and there. 
Its worth the drive to Hot Springs...do NOT miss this.

Stopped in Hot Springs to see the Mammoth Site and glad we did.  The site was extremely interesting and well done. The tour was certainly helpful in understanding what we were looking at. We managed to keep busy in Hot Springs for a couple of days, no problem.

Out of the way gem for a budding archeologist. Great guides, very large gift shop with something for everyone. The site was indoors so a nice day trip for a rainy day.  The actual site was super
Interesting and moderately interactive for all age groups.
This place is so cool! If you haven't seen so many bones in one place it's worth to visit it. I liked it!

This place is one of a kind. It is a huge Mammoth Dig site under a roof and surrounded by a museum and gift shop and research facilities. There is something for every age group to do and learn. Definitely take the tour to get the most out of the trip.

name: Splash Central Waterpark
address: 345 9th St SW, Huron, SD 57350, USA
reviews: Enjoy the summer by cooling off at Splash Central. My boys go every day for hours, lots to do and fun to be had. Go down the Master Blaster or the body slide. Relax in the Lazy River. Let the little ones play in the Kiddie Pool. Or race each other on the Whipit!

This is a smaller version of Wild Water West, minus the wave pool (and adult drinks, but this is their city pool so I get it). The admittance fee is low, they even have a reduced price for non swimmers. The concession cost are not terrible or even really considered over priced in my book (not like going to a movie- cheap to get in, a life savings to snack). The slides are great, love the lazy river, and the kids all love the variety of things to play on.

Love the lazy river really friendly staff very attentive to need if their guests!! The lazy river is very enjoyable, the water slides are a great time, the Olympic sized pool with an inflatable for the kids to burn all that summer energy on! They have like little cabanas to multiple purposes. I recommend this place for price and passes.
It's an awesome water park for a fair price. No where near as expensive as Wild Water West outside of Sioux Falls, but still plenty of fun activities to do there.
Best water park that we have been to in South Dakota. Slides r fun, lazy river perfect on a really hot day. Will b back for just the waterpark🌊🏊⛲

name: Bob's Lounge
address: 114 W Dakota Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews:
My waitress way cool and friendly. 
Ice cold beer. Great atmosphere
Small but cozy bar. Shandies on tap. Favorite side bar of many people. Music and popcorn are always ready.
Service was fine. Drink was okay. Place could have been cleaner.
Love this little dive, feels like home..
Great place for a drink after hunting.

name: Wind Cave National Park
address: South Dakota, USA
reviews: Great tour! Gets very cold on tour...bring a jacket. Worth the wait. Hard to get good pictures due to low light and no flash.

as I read other reviews, I see negativity about the cave elevators being down.  not 1 review mentioned the phenomenal opportunity about getting out of the vehicle and going for a hike.  I am a regular here and have had numerous wildlife experiences that were beyond description. If you have the ability to go for a hike. you will likely be rewarded big time.

Elevator broke back in July 2019 and the park superintendent estimated a month for repairs. It's now February 2020 (8 months) and there's no update. For a park whose sole attraction is a cave, it's absurd to not be able to enter the cave.

We still enjoyed learning about the area and it's history.  At times it seemed too close even though we were in our van or at a safe distance. Inside the cave is quite interesting if you have never been in a cave before, but even regular cave dwellers will probably find this cave intriguing. But the elevator still isn't working; it's a bummer not to be able to enter the cave. The elevator was not working when we were there, so there were no cave tours at all. I don't know what I was expecting when we were offered a tour of the largest natural opening, but I was a bit surprised.

Looking for a Colorado Springs adventure. Was afraid this was going to be lame after checking out the website, could not have been more wrong. This place has beyond amazing mountain views, especially of Pike's Peak. The building is very clean, and well updated. The Discovery tour was $23 for adults, $17 for kids older than 6, and well worth it. Learned a lot, and enjoyed the cave. Gift shop is really good, hard not to spend a lot of $ here. I wanted to do the Terror-Dactyl ride, but it was $50 and they didn't allow any glasses/sunglasses, and I didn't have my contacts in. I will come back next time I am in CO Springs. Awesome place! Great for kids and adults alike.

name: Ingalls Homestead
address: 20812 Homestead Rd, De Smet, SD 57231, USA
reviews: Our family had an incredible time here! The historic interpreters were so engaging with my daughters, there were more things to see than we had time for, and everything we saw had such a sweet balance of the story of the books and the real life history of the time and place. I really hope we get to visit again!

Very fun place to visit. They have a great setup with many hands-on things to do. We spent over 4 hours here but it only felt like 1 because the kids had so much fun. All of the staff were really friendly.
I was surprised at how much I remembered from the books as we toured the place.  The historic actors with the information were wonderful. The place is well maintained and a long over due visit.

Such a beautiful place!! For the best experience, we suggest to plan ahead to stay on the prairie in a real wagon or the bunkhouse. Our kids loved it!! Even our teenagers found FUN on the farm! The workers were so kind and helpful and really engaging and knowledgeable. The shower houses weren’t far away and they were clean and water was warm. Family ran and they were super sweet!! Highly recommend!! ❤️❤️

One of our top favorite places in all of SD. Every trip is a different experience. We always spend all day and our 6 year old never gets bored. The owners are so personable. You'll want to come back every year.

name: Rushmore Cave
address: 13622 SD-40, Keystone, SD 57751, USA
reviews: We had a wonderful tour of this beautiful cave today. The young lady ( I can't remember her name) was so friendly and knowledgeable. My husband and I were the only ones in the tour so it felt very personable. I would definitely recommend the cave tour. Many parts were absolutely stunning and you are able to get amazing pictures.
This caves are awesome, great place to enjoy with family, lot of stairs but if u don't have knee problems or very little kid you are fine. Love this place. Very unique

We had a great visit to the cave today with Joe as our guide. He was super professional and very informative. He even chatted with our kids as we walked through the cave, which was welcomed for my wife and I, so we could focus on our younger son navigating all the steps without touching the cave walls. We were very impressed and found it to be well worth the money spent. Our kids were so excited after they left the cave, and they said they had made a new friend.

Our tour guide Kevin did an amazing job, it was a blast for young and old alike! He had an excellent sense of humor and was very knowledgeable about the cave. Pricing was acceptable, but we opted not to go on any rides due to time limitations.

The lady friend and I both did the 1 hour cave tour with Kevin and loved it. He was very entertaining and knowledgeable. 

The lady friend did the rollercoaster and had a blast on it. 

Would definitely come back here again.

name: Devils Tower National Monument
address: WY-110, Devils Tower, WY 82714, USA
reviews:
This was one of our most favorite stops on our road trip vacation. It was awesome seeing the tower in the distance as you drive towards it.
And as you get there it was way better in person than any picture we've ever seen of it.
I highly recommend taking the time and walk around the entire perimeter on the tower. Al of the different views are worth the walk.
This will definitely be on our list to return to someday...

I don't feel this place can be accurately described in words. Much like the grand canyon, you have to see this with your own eyes to truly appreciate what an amazing monument it is. I visited as a teenager and years later brought my family to visit. Hopefully I'll get to visit again one day.
We hiked around it, took a bunch of pictures, watched the wildlife around and just enjoyed the spectacular view of this towering mass of rock and the beautiful surrounding country.

This was a beautiful stop on a road trip I took in the summer. The walk around the monument was fun and there are lots of places to take photos. The washrooms at the park were clean and maintained. Definitely would stop again in the future. Using the tower viewers to try and find the old wooden stairs was incredibly fun as well.

Can't describe how awesome this National Monument is! Have to see it in person to fully understand how this formed. Beautiful park with easy walking trail around monument. Visitors center describes how this formed (or what they all agree upon). Worth the drive!

Really great national park. We did the long loop and it was just gorgeous! The views were awesome. The only downside was we weren’t allowed to take our golden retriever puppies on the hike. Unfortunately, because people don’t clean up after their little furry friends, most national parks don’t allow pets. But still take the time to visit this national park. It will be worth your time.

name: Crazy Horse Memorial
address: 12151 Ave of the Chiefs, Crazy Horse, SD 57730, USA
reviews:
Surprisingly Good Experience, 
Well Worth the $30/car!
Don’t assume it is fogged in when Mt Rushmore is. 
Family visited 3/15/2020 with full sun.  

Intro video was worthwhile background;
Restaurant had surprisingly good and unique entrees. Gift shop was full of quality stuff, 
Optional van ride $4/person was well worth it.  Very pleasant staff.
Museum area is one stop viewing of all things Native American.
Scale plaster model outside is good reference and to take pictures in front of.

Very interesting finally seeing it for the first time in real life. I've seen many pictures and videos over the years. But being there is a completely different experience.
I hope I'm still around to see it completed someday. 
It's worth the trip to go and see...

Very informative, recommend to check out the the documentary in the theatre in the visitors center. The carving itself is not complete yet but they are making progress. The progress is very slow and we understand why it is that after watching the documentary. Good lesson on American history. Its worth going here of you are going to Mt Rushmore

This was a really eye opening experience. Crazy horse memorial has a really inspiring story behind it. You have to watch the film inside the museum in order to understand everything behind crazy horse. Also be sure to take a ride in the bus that takes you to the base of the mountain. It was a pleasant experience. I would recommend this to anyone.

If you can go there. Please do. They are privately funded by donations. No help from the government at all. A family legacy in the making. An amazing place to be with family. The lazer light show is beautiful. It is more of a museum so not so much hands on for kids. But the performances are amazing and kids will love it. Staff are loving and visit with guests a lot. One of the best places to go.

name: Cosmos Mystery Area
address: 24040 Cosmos Rd, Rapid City, SD 57702, USA
reviews: Awesome sauce. Everyone in the family from 8 to 38 had a great time. Price is just right. Time is just right. So it is a must.
Was super fun. We went on a pretty busy day I think, because the groups were rather big. It was kind of hard for all of us to fit in the small rooms. Overall pleasantly satisfied with out stop out.

This was such a cool, crazy place!  Our guide had several demonstrations to show how weird this place really is.  Great audience interaction and the kids were just thrilled to participate in the demonstrations.  Lots of fun and laughs to be had...try it out!
This place was fun!! The tour guide was adorable, she really tried so hard to get everyone to interact. I've always wanted to see one of these "vortex" houses, and it was very cool!

Great place to bring the kids! A word of warning for adults; the experience left me feeling a little queasy! The tour is totally worth it, and my kids enjoyed cracking open their own geodes afterwards! A great way to spend an hour or so!

name: Chapel In the Hills
address: 3788 Chapel Ln, Rapid City, SD 57702, USA
reviews: This is a beautiful chapel. I visited it in the winter when it was closed to visitors, but I was able to walk the grounds and tour the outside. All if the carvings on the outside were stunning to look at. I can't wait to come back in the spring when it is open to the public.

It was a dream come true for me!! It was the 50 anniversary - my grandmother came Norway I had heard stories and seen pictures of chapels in Norway.  It is something I will carry with me forever.  If you have Norwegian heredity it is a must place you must see.  The beauty the reverence of what truly God is.

The Chapel in the Hills is absolutely beautiful! I've loved it since the first time I visited, and I've dreamed of having my wedding at the Chapel. However, I was extremely disappointed to find out that just recently in late 2019, the Chapel changed their policy so couples MUST use their Lutheran pastors to officiate weddings at the chapel. While I understand that they have the freedom to hold this rule, it's very disappointing, especially since this is a newly implemented policy. I'll continue to visit and admire the Chapel in the Hills, but am very disappointed in this recent change of policy.

The architecture is breathtaking.   It was the day of their closing , we were at a wedding it was so cold inside the chapel, no heat.  I will go back in Spring or summer.  I didn't get to the gift shop so must go back.
Some of the most amazing wood work you will see. The property is just as beautiful. Free, but be sure to try to take a small donation to help maintain. You won't regret it

name: 1880 Train
address: 222 Railroad Ave, Hill City, SD 57745, USA
reviews: This is a fun adventure for the family. I have dinner the summer train ride to Keystone and the winter Santa ride. I would just recommend if you are traveling with small children to just do the one way ride and not the full round trip option, but it is awesome to be on this old-school train and enjoy the beautiful views with the family.

This is such a fun place me and the kids went and after we was done"bringing" Santa back from the north Pole my 5 year old yes can we go again! The cookies and hot chocolate served on the train was great!  This is a must!

We want to the Black Hills to do a bunch of hiking.   The 1880 train was a very fun break from all of that.   The ride was relaxing and fun for all ages.   If you are a train buff, this is a no-brainer.

I’m glad that the 1880’s train has kept steam alive, it’s what built this country!  I took my family on the train, and my kids loved it, and so did I!  The prices aren’t as bad as some have said, it’s 2019 and this type of equipment is expensive to fix, I’m a pipefitter By trade, so I would know.  The ride was great, scenery was good and narration was also nice to learn the history about the area.  I will continue to visit and highly recommend the 1880’s train to anyone I know!

Such a happy experience, especially with children! The train is nostalgic and homey, tastefully decorated and plenty warm. The staff is top notch, from the elves to the conductor to Santa Claus. I highly, highly recommend making this a holiday tradition.

name: The Journey Museum and Learning Center
address: 222 New York St, Rapid City, SD 57701, USA
reviews: The museum is ambitious and strives to keep the good balance among science, history, and culture. The downside is that it’s a bit costly for its small size. In other words, the place could have more displays to make the visit longer and worthwhile, or reduce the price a bit, especially for adults who take the kids there.

Lived in south Dakota my whole life and never know it existed. What a nice hidden treasure we found. Purchased an annual pass as it makes for a fun day of learning and activities with my son. So many things to do and such a great way to learn about many different topics.

We spent a day going to museums in Rapid City.. This place was outstanding!!! It takes a person from the dinosaur age to modern time. Plan to spend a couple hours or more, if you want to see everything and read all of the descriptive material at each exhibit.. It was a great time... And educational..👍

A lot of educational stuff for adults if you want to know the history of South Dakota, and enough stuff to keep kids busy if you have them along too. We really liked reading about all the different types of rocks and the exhibit that displayed all the different beautiful gems was really cool. The gift shop had plenty of South Dakota related things in it but so does every other place in the area.
My daughter loved the wide range of history about the local area.  The exhibits are really well done and engaging.  The staff was super helpful.

name: Sturgis Motorcycle Museum & Hall of Fame
address: 999 Main St, Sturgis, SD 57785, USA
reviews:
This is a place that you have to go to if you're  in Sturgis. There are many bike in the museum,  I was just a little disappointed considering this is the hot bed of the motorcycle world.

Should you go to the museum? Yea go anyway  it part of tourist  trap and does has some interesting exhibits
Visited here on 02/20/2020 and not only was it fun and informative the lady working there was very friendly .  much appreciated a good experience on a long move between Denver and ND.
Enjoyed the history. Clerk was very nice and helpful

Wow. There are motorcycles from the 1920's here, and they are beautiful! The artwork throughout the entire building is gorgeous and unique, but I won't forget those motorcycles. Definitely a place to check out if in the area, interested in motorcycles and history, or just interested in art.
A must stop when in Sturgis to support the local motorcycle museum which had a bunch of lovely bikes in there and a lot of motorcycle history anybody who rides should definitely stop.

name: Museum of Geology
address: 501 E St Joseph St, Rapid City, SD 57701, USA
reviews: Best part aside from its incredible breath and quality: it’s free to visit! They have fossils large and small, local and international, spanning across several eons of time. There is also an incredible display of minerals, meteorites, and fluorescent minerals. The gift shop is reasonably prices too. My pictures are just a SMALL FRACTION of what’s there and don’t include any of the large fossils or meteorites. I arrived too late in the day this particular visit to take as many photos as I wanted; it’s easy to spend several hours there (and I have!).

This museum is awesome! It takes up the 3rd floor of an academic building but is well-labeled with visitor parking out front. The exhibits are very well labeled and organized, with one area containing rocks/minerals and the other area containing fossils. I appreciated the old-school feel of the museum, with the displays being more informative than flashy. They have a great variety of fossils, with some common and some rare (but all exciting). The best part, the museum is free (but appreciates donations). Well worth the stop, looking forward to visiting again someday!

I loved my visit here! I really like how they have the minerals organized. There's even an area to keep younger kids occupied. Lots of great fossils too, but personally I am more of a rock-hound. The fluorescent display is really cool.

This is a great, free place to go for a little education!  There weren't many interactive things for kids to do throughout the museum except for a few things in the kids area, but the front desk has a scavenger hunt for kids that takes them all over the museum.  The labeling on each case could be a little better to make the scavenger hunt flow a bit better, but the kids get to pick a rock at the end which was super fun!!  A great place for homeschoolers too!!
Lots of great exhibits that you can experience up close. Plus it's FREE! The kids loved seeing a variety of fossils and minerals. Check for parking right in front of the building after the busy hours

name: Dinosaur Park
address: 940 Skyline Dr, Rapid City, SD 57701, USA
reviews:
Such a cool spot! My seven year old loved climbing on and around all the dinosaurs. It's totally free to go, and the store had some really great stuff that we haven't found anywhere else.

It was such a hit that we ended up going twice, first at the start of our trip and then again almost a week later when we were leaving.

If you're in the area and have a dinosaur fan, it's really worth the trip. The dinos are around 90 years old if memory serves and some could use a little more paint, but it doesn't detract from the experience.

One of my favorite places. Beautiful views, fun for kids to see the dinosaurs that are larger than them. Also historical aspect is great :) I have a photo of my grandparents here, my mom, me, and my children here all during different times.
Great place for families and its free! The views of rapid are the best in the whole city.

We lived in Rapid City over 20 yrs ago and it was fun to see this attraction again after all these years!  They have made some very nice improvements and a visitor center that was closed at the time we visited.

This is a simple park with old dinosaur statues that was created, I believe during great depression. There are a lot of stairs. It gives kids an area to burn out some energy. There's a great view of Rapid City at the top.  My kids enjoy visiting just like I did as a kid.

name: The Outdoor Campus - West
address: Adventure Trail, Rapid City, SD 57702, USA
reviews: This place is amazing! We came on free try canoeing and kayaking day! Great friendly very helpful staff! My older 2 kids (9&11) took a canoe together and had a heck of a time figuring it out, but one of the instructors came out in the water to their aide to teach them right away and had nothing but joy in helping them! I can't say enough good about this place and it's staff! Thank you for the experience & the fun!
Great place to learn about wildlife and the outdoors. Awesome classes that you can sign up for to learn about the basics of outdoor recreation.

It has something for everyone. Both inside and along it's nature trails. With diarama's of wildlife and a aquarium of many different fish. It has many occupations for the young and mature mind. A pond to learn to kayak and fish a archery range. Hunters safety courses, and many groups meeting to promote photography, wildlife and water conservation, and disabled veterans fly fishing. There is something for everyone. Contact the Campus for classes and activities hosted daily and through out the year.
Wonderful place to bring the family.  They offer many classes and the campus is beautiful.  Their mud day is super fun! Definitely worth a visit and most things are free of charge!

I always enjoy coming to Outdoor Campus. It is free and embraces learning through exploration.  When my kids were little we came to some classes and family nights. Now we come when we have company to give an overview of Black Hills wildlife and land.

name: RedRossa Italian Grille
address: 808 W Sioux Ave Ste 200, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews:
I was in town for work and asked a couple locals where to eat, this was recommended as one of their favorites! 

Upon arrival I was seated prompt and courteously, the place has a great ambiance and is pretty classy.
