For food they were on the last day of their “Taste of New Orleans” menu, so I decided to take advantage of it and ordered the “French Quarters Jambalaya” and their “Chop Chop” salad from their main menu. 

Both were very delicious!  The Jambalaya was generously filled with shrimp, crawfish and andouille sausage! The salad had a perfect pairing of mixed greens, smoked mozzarella, banana peppers, Italian salami, then topped with a red wine vinaigrette! 

Pricing was fair,  some may say it seems high for a small town restaurant.

Everything is clean and the servers are friendly. 
Was not impressed with the food, though. It's  great if you like frozen microwave food or out of a can food. I had the lasagna and it was cold in the middle and really had no flavor, fake cheese? 1 star.
The server was great she was delightful my wife and I were very happy to have such an engaged employee.  The food was excellent and delivered to our table quickly.  We will be back.
Great food. Love the desserts. Good customer service. Very friendly staff.

We had reservations on Valentine’s Day. When we got there the lobby was full of people waiting and we were told we would have to wait at least 20 minutes, even with our reservation. The hostess was quite short with us and was openly blaming the kitchen for being behind. When we did finally get seated and waited on, our waitress was great and the food was delicious. I’m not sure I’ll plan to go here for another holiday, though.

name: La Minestra
address: 106 E Dakota Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: I went for dinner with a friend. I had been for lunch and dinner was just as good. From the house salad to egg plant parmagan it was excellent. Servive was amazing. A friendly family restaurant with an open kitchen. The table with next to us had a great pizza. A place to go back to and try different menu items.

Went to La Minestra for the first time today... Greeted at the entrance with a friendly hello.. We arrived when they first opened for lunch.  Nicely furnished and decorated, including the floors.  The staff was super friendly and ready to go into detailed description of the menu items. The menu is small, but adequate.  We ordered two of the lunch specials.  I ordered the chicken tortellini/ sun-dried tomatoes/ spinach with a cream sauce and a 1/2 Ceasars salad... My husband ordered the clam chowder soup with a turkey wrap.. Both meals were great... He loved the clam chowder.  We both sampled all of the food.  My only negatives were.. The sauce on the tortellini was some what runny. Also, the romaine lettuce was not in small enough pieces.. Its hard to cut it yourself without having it all over the table and you. The clam chowder was thick, the the sauce on the tortellini should of been too... The tortellini tasted very good though.  We would definitely go back.. Expect to pay about $15 or more with a drink and tip.   Upbeat place with good food and a happy staff!

I like this place because it has a flavor distinct from the rest of the food in Pierre. I've only eaten their lunch specials, which change daily.

Their newer happy hour menu is great. Nice selection and reasonably priced. I appreciate the smaller portions and $2 price tag, so I can order a variety.

Wait staff is consistently on point, friendly, quick, and apologetic if something doesn't go right.
Service and food were perfect tonight. Could go a little lighter on the rosemary on the truffle fries, but everything else was perfect. The mussles over linguine needs to be on the menu!! So good!!!
Neat little place, you wont find spaghetti here but lots of other great entrees.   Staff is friendly and prompt.  Prices are reasonable.

name: Mad Mary's Steakhouse & Saloon
address: 110 E Dakota Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: The cost is on the high side but the food is very good and the service was amazing!
When we walked in we were greeted very friendly very clean place good food nice atmosphere I would recommend for anybody to go eat there

We were there on a Tuesday evening and the place was very busy.  Even so. We were waited on pretty quickly.  Ordered small sirloin and garlic mashed potatoes.  Food was delivered quickly and was very good. Would eat here again.
Good steak, great service and with cowboys on tv, you feel like you're right in the wild west. Drinks are pretty stiff (which is good!)
Food is amazing, service is great, the wait is not that long, its cozy and great for groups. It's just a really good place to eat.

name: Guadalajara Mexican Restaurant
address: 314 W Sioux Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: AWESOME FOOD!! Very reasonable price for the amount of food serviced... The restaurant was very busy but we did not have to wait long for our order...  So GREAT FOOD, AWESOME SERVICE I LOOK FORWARD TO DINING THERE AGAIN

Nice restaurant with a lot of seats inside.
When we were there, there wasn’t any music playin-it made the atmosphere sad. 
Food was tasty but nothing outstanding.

Don't bother.
The salsa has no tomato chunks. It is cilantro and onion soup with a watery tomato base.

The pollo fundido is bland (but pretty moist) chicken wrapped in a tortilla (either fried or not) and then they have the audacity to slap a slice of processed american cheese on top of each one. Even after I smothered it in sour creme I couldn't suffer through it.

The chili verde is a green onion and tough cubes of pork smothered in....something. even the rice here needs hot sauce to have flavor.

Oh and they have nothing on draft.
Was recommended tonus, and worth it! Chips n salsa when u sit down..great margaritas and lots of food!
Great dining experience.  Terrific variety on the menu. Reasonable prices and large portions. My family all agreed it was the best meal we have had in awhile.

name: Richie Z's Brickhouse BBQ & Grill
address: 401 S Central Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Just ate there for first time. Special was smoked meatloaf with mashed potatoes and gravy and corn with a bun. Holy smokes it was so good!  Big portions and great service.  5 stars

Richie Z's is a great addition to Pierre! They have an extensive menu with something for everyone. The atmosphere is also really great. They really did well renovating the space. I would highly recommend!
Had a great lunch with the family! Sandwiches were all great, fries were crispy, and sauce was good too! Would recommend to friends and family.

Just went there tonight and had the worst service ever!! They ran out of the  Prime Rib that we wanted so had to reorder, but I didn’t get what I ordered after 2 hours of waiting!!  Then our waitress was carrying her baby around while serving our food!! Really!!!  Not sure who owns or runs this place but WOW!! Can’t believe that your service can be so bad!
Top notch bbq. Richie is a great pitmaster and if you're anywhere near Pierre, South Dakota you must stop in to the Brickhouse.

name: Wonderful House
address: 317 S Pierre St, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: The owners were from Fujian, where it’s known for great cooking and cuisine. I'd say this is the tastiest and fairly authentic Chinese American restaurant in town. If you like Chinese food, don't miss this one.

Our family of five tried a few different items and they were all pretty good. We tried the wontons, salt and pepper shrimp, honey chicken, and the spicy sesame chicken. All of them were a little above average on the Chinese quality scale. The staff was very helpful and kind. The price of all of them items were slightly higher than they should be.
THE FOOD IS SO GOOD and they are so kind 😊 take out is WONDERFUL here

It is self serve/carryout..
At noon they have a buffet.
Essentially there is no table service.

Our meals were deep fat fried...sweet/sour chicken or pork. Meals were tasty with generous portions.

Prior to the remodel, table service was provided and the atmosphere reflected oriental features.

Atmosphere is more like a fast food place.

Prices were reasonable.
I absolutely love eating at Wonderful House! The food is always fresh and hot and the service is excellent. They really make you feel like family!

name: Pure Bliss Cupcake Co
address: 107 E Capitol Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Reasonable prices, delicious food, and excellent service. You'll never leave here unhappy, constantly great.
Cute and cozy. Great cupcakes. Lovely atmosphere. Awesome interior design.
We went there for a short break in the afternoon, it was nice and quick. Great coffee, and wonderful cupcake.

The most delicious cupcakes I have ever had in my life. The lady was so kind and answered all my questions. The sweets are beautiful and taste wonderful. Great place to order all your sweet tooth treats. Love it.

What a cute little place! They have baked goods made fresh every day, like cinnamon rolls, caramel rolls, and a few flavors of cupcakes that change often. On weekdays there are two featured lunch specials of home-made deliciousness, ranging from soups to sandwiches to meatloaf to hot beef with mashed potatoes. The specials change every day and often depend on what's in season. On Saturdays there is a featured brunch item, like lemon poppyseed pancakes, breakfast burritos, waffles topped with fresh peaches, and so much more. It's always fresh and amazing! Specials change daily, so stop in or check their Facebook page to see what they have. I have loved it every time!

name: Gators Pizza
address: 1615 N Harrison Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Gators Pizza is located inside the center of the mall in Pierre.  They have a large variety of food to choose from and are full of flavor.  Even during peak times of service; food output was incredibly fast without sacrifice of quality.  To see the owner interacting with customers is a pleasant twist to see in this day and age; I wish I saw this more often in other restaurants.  The area is filled with a good positive and energetic energy and I can see that the employees enjoy what they do here.  Location is very clean and table clean up during peak times is also fast.  They have SD video lottery in the back and they also sell beer here.  Prices are pretty fair for the quality of the food you get; for a large 3 topping pizza, 2 monsters, and breadsticks cost around $30.  If you are in Pierre and want some good pizza, salads, and soups; check this place out.
The food is always good. I do find it to be over priced for its value. I do like the variety of menu options.

Allowing 36 people in your restaurant is irresponsible!! Pierre ordinance says you can only have 10z  It last on surfaces for 10 days and what about your bathrooms. I don’t belive those CDC guidelines. You will spread it all around Pierrre.
Nice atmosphere..good soup
My brother-in-law is a diabetic so he has to have the thin crust and my sister and brother line myself had pizza on Sunday night it was not greasy not a lot of sauce just perfect thanks Pizza Hut

name: Tokyo Japanese Restaurant
address: 1615 N Harrison Ave #27, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews:
Went with an experienced friend, my 1st time to eat there.
Food was better than I had prepared for!
Cindy and her staff are very friendly and helpful.
The staff are polite and very helpful and the food is always delicious.  We never wait long. It is a breath of fresh air here in the middle of the continental US of A to have this delicacy.
It was definitely awesome! We lived it and it's our new favorite place 😁

Roughly only took a half hour from the point of walking in the door to being done with my meal. Probably one of the better places in Pierre to eat in my opinion. Honestly it was a little bit of a struggle finding gluten free options at first, since their isn’t a separate menu you have to ask or be knowledge about the rolls and how they are different here. But the staff work with you and now that they’ve all dealt with it they navigate your options easier now. But the food is taste, the service is super strong as everyone will check in with you and how your meal is going, and the options are varied. I suggest the steak hibachi if you aren’t a sushi person.

I came here on opening day fully expecting it to be a disaster. Much to my surprise, everything was running smoothly and efficiently. I ordered 3 rolls to go, it was buy 2 get 1 free. I was provided hot tea while I waited which was delicious and such a pleasant surprise. It took about 20 minutes for the rolls, but they were all amazing and definitely worth the wait. I grabbed a menu so I can call ahead next time. The dining room is clean and open, and there is a sushi bar to sit at as well. Staff was super friendly and inviting and I can't wait to go back. Excellent addition to our community!

name: Jake's Good Times Place
address: 620 S Cleveland Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: This place, the staff and the food are awesome!! Amanda is always a great server (they all are but she’s my fav). I love the food: wings, burgers and riblets are my go-to dishes. Great place to hang out and have drinks and good food. When we get back to normal, it’ll be the first place I go.

Great food, the Nachos and Wings were the best I've had in a long time.   Only beat by a Dive Bar in the middle of Alaska.   Coming from the Washington DC area where dive bars and greasy spoons can be found almost every a corner.   They don't even  compare to this food.

So it’s a dive bar and the atmosphere is pretty much what you’d expect. The salad bar could use a better eye to what your staff puts out. Lettuce that’s really bruised and starting to go bad shouldn’t be put out.... or intentionally buried at the bottom. The bathrooms need a complete overhaul. The floor is uneven and the in the stalls there is tile missing.... which shows exposed the exposed wall and the water damage there. 

Really my only good thing to say about Jake’s is the wait staff. Super polite and good about keeping your drinks full and your order needs taken care of. 

That being said the food could use a lifesaver. I went a few times and the pork riblet basket was a lot more sad that I was expecting? When I got the ribs it was a 50/50 split between good and horrible. One side was  so over done and crispy that it crunched worse than popcorn would? The other have was actually really good and done to a nice level..... just don’t know how you can have such polar opposites in one side of ribs...
Consistently good food and service.  Standard pub fare.  I recommend the Reuben.

Got sat down and got served by a cranky waitress. Had to confirm our order twice. The food came out quick but was disappointing. 
Ordered the taco salad. 
Tortilla was stale. Meat was poorly seasoned. Used an old tasting mixed salad for the lettuce. Poorly chopped. The tomatoes were under ripe.  
Waitress never came back to check on us. 
Country radio station playing in the background with commercials and all.
Overall the place looks dated and worn down. Kind of a shame for a Pierre staple.
The riblets were decent.

name: Gallos Mexican Restaurant
address: 366 S Pierre St, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Reheated food Menudos were very poor along with the sour cocktail with black avocado pieces with 6 shrimps my total was ridiculous!!!!

I was skeptical coming here. We are from the West coast where we were surrounded by Mexican culture. We have eaten at probably hundreds of different restaurants and taco trucks..... But I must say that I am very impressed and I was very satisfied with my meal. It was rich in flavor and tasted fresh. I am now going to be a regular customer. Not to mention, the restaurant is decorated perfectly and gives us the feeling of being back home.

Amazing food and customer service even though it was only one person working. Best Mexican food I've found in South Dakota. Definitely coming back as soon as I can. If you're looking for that authentic hole in the wall Mexican place this is perfect.

For a restaurant so say they have good food and they show it. This is not that restaurant. I will say I'm very disappointed in this place. My little brother and I ate here maybe a month ago, I'm not going back.
I ordered the shrimp fajitas, little brother ordered nachos. His nachos were great. Mine not to much, the shrimp was warm to the point of cold, my peppers were under cooked and the over all dish had no flavor, salt and pepper never killed anyone. Oh did I mention that everything came out in under 5 minutes. That's scary! In the end we ordered a fried icecream. Maybe I'm not used to the way they do it here but it was fried than frozen, came out also in under 5 minutes.

Having to lie on my way out the door while I had a sick stomach was not fun, I dont like to be rude. I have sat on this for a month, mad that I had to lie, mad that I got sick, and mad the food was made poorly

This is for a visit back in August. Very delicious and authentic. Really liked the mole sauce. I'm docking two stars though because the owner wasn't too friendly to us. I feel like when you own a restaurant you should be a little more welcoming to patrons.

name: Taco John's
address: 415 E Sioux Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Despite living in a place that has authentic Mexican food, when we're visiting family here, I always have to stop here. Food is as tasty as it has always been. Service was fast and personable. Would recommend.
Sometimes the service and food quality depend on the shift or time of day, but overall I have found this Taco John's to be fast, reliable, and pretty good.

This location has always been great about getting the order correct the first time. I sometimes go near the cutoff time for breakfast and they never try to make me feel bad about the time. My food is always hot and fresh. Easy to get in and out of this location right off the main road.
I genuinely love the employees and the food. They've never gotten my order wrong and they're always friendly and show great customer service. They know how to work a business and I keep going back :)
Great supper.  Quick and friendly service.

name: Drifters Bar & Grille
address: 325 Hustan Ave, Fort Pierre, SD 57532, USA
reviews: Six of us ate here and tried a variety of different foods, they all were fantastic. We also tried the Gambit of craft beers that they had available, with a decent selection, most of which were local. Great views, food, and drink... Not much else you need!

Good food. A few different menu items than the typical restaurant items I see far too often.   Batender was good for some friendly conversation. That's appreciated when I'm traveling alone.  Worth a stop in.  Hope I can get here some time when the sun is up to see the river view.

Housemade items are simply amazing! Staff is extremely efficient, honest, and exhibits the quality of a real team. Best of all, they have the best views of the upper midwest. Prices are so reasonable for all the amenities- it makes Drifters a worthwhile destination of it's own. If only there was a rating higher than 5 stars. 

Review of our delightful menu items. The Beet hummus is fresh and delightful. Quite enjoyable for the novice and expert veggie eater. The burger?!? Beyond amazing. However the fries seem to be hand cut and so extremely fresh it's like eating a sliced baked potato. The Ahi Tuna entree features well prepared sticky cold rice, but flavors beyond typical Midwest capabilities.  Congrats to this restaurant for the creation. The wasabi peas were slightly disappointing- as well as the ornamental seaweed paper - but it is Pierre, SD. The leading role-  Ahi Tuna hold a delightful quality and at just $17.00 the entree is overall simply amazing.
Bacon wrapped steak had a great flavor.  Sweet potato  fries were very good.

Beautiful location, an interesting, varied menu, and responsive, knowledgeable service. Server, Matt, was friendly and warm without being ingratiating and made excellent food and drink recommendations. I appreciated the Impossible Burger options as that opened up a whole section of the menu for vegetarians. Veggie dining is not so easy in Pierre/Ft. Pierre, but this dinner made being a vegetarian in a mixed-eater crowd group effortless.  Portions are way bigger than necessary, so count on a take-home box!

name: Big Tom's Diner
address: 1415 E Wells Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Big Tom's is amazing! The sloppy Joe basket is definitely my favorite, it's a shame it's a weekend special. Oh well! My only complaint is that whenever I call in, I'm usually met with really rude responses. I don't let it sully my opinion though because I'm always greeted with smiles when I come into the restaurant or drive through.
Food is amazing! We've been here 3 times now and its always been great. Staff is super friendly and the price is just right.

Great food; everything is homemade on site! Very reasonable prices, with daily specials. I've been there many times and get something different each time. I've never been disappointed.  Charming diner decor with fast service. The staff is friendly and seem to genuinely enjoy working there. Check it out (be sure to try the sweet potato fries)!!

Always friendly, top notch staff. Food is typical home town diner, but done well. Buns are amazing, though they tend to get soggy under their burgers. 
Really my only gripe there. Great sweet potato fries. Patty melt is AWESOME.
We had to try this place according to all the positive reviews, and I would say that the reviews are accurate. Just a good old fashioned diner with excellent fries and burgers to match!

name: Dairy Queen Grill & Chill
address: 519 W Sioux Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Good food, waited on promptly & courteously. Very helpful when I wanted to take the rest of my food home.
The service is always super fast through drive-thru, I've only been inside once and it was new so everything was clean. The employees have always been nice.
Was very impressed by the fast paced service in all areas...staff were all helping each other and doing a excellent job keeping the lobby area clean
Blizzard of the month was good. Angela recommended it.
Opening week, they were very busy but well staffed. Very quick service.

name: Zesto
address: 213 W Capitol Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: This is a famous place for getting some really yummy flavored ice cream, from Sundaes to shakes and cones. We swung by almost every night for my two week vacation here for a different flavored ice cream, after eating dinner. It is cash only, but it's worth it. There are some tables and chairs outside in the back.  This is an order from outside place only.  There is handicap parking available.

Can’t tell you the quality of ice cream. I can only say that it being “cash only” killed it for me. It’s 2019 there are several options to get a card reader without it being a nightmare as the owner.... perhaps it’s time you got an updated system? No outdoor seating or alcoves makes getting ice cream here a no go as the temps start dropping like they always do in Oct. 

Honestly I went to Dairy Queen because of the card options.

A very dated location, but the friendly staff is very welcoming.

The large turtle was amazing. Honestly, the price was fantastic. 

Although the place can be extremely busy and requires a lot of waiting, it definitely is worth it. I would recommend attempting to sneak by during a less busy time, it is always worth it.

Incredible little art deco-ish ice cream place that also serves lunch.  Service was fast and friendly, although we only ordered ice cream.  Several other customers had ordered lunch and the orders seemed to be served quickly. Reasonable prices, $4 for a small dirty river, twist ice cream, how fudge and crushed Oreos.  Next time we're in the area, we'll be back.
Good selection, but no hard ice cream. But I enjoy thier malts.

name: Pizza Ranch
address: 321 E Hustan Ave, Fort Pierre, SD 57532, USA
reviews: Good place for a pizza buffet. Also has fried chicken, pasta and salad. The staff was a little slow cleaning up after people left.

The food was excellent as always.  It must've been a busy day because we had a little trouble finding a clean table.  Most of them had been recently vacated but the staff was doing their best to keep up with the patrons.
Good food and nice people

This is the place of all places. For a girl with a milk allergy this place is heaven and hell and everything in between like Nirvana. I can suffer on one side of the buffet and on the other I risk temptation because we all know which side is better. Lastly don't go to the back room like ever. Many travelers have entered only I have returned. God bless Amen.
Really good food and friendly staff

name: Domino's Pizza
address: 1419 E Wells Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Great location on Sioux Avenue with easy access and parking. Friendly service with a few tables to dine in the building. Good quality Domino's food and service.  Have reasonable prices and regular specials. Nice hot and tasty pizza, chicken, and other err items.
Great food, fast service. You cant get better pizza in town
Superior balance between quality and convenience. Better than Pizza Hut any day of the week. Always check the coupons. 5/5 will continue to eat domino's again.
Cheesy bread was just the ticket. Good stuff, courteous staff...I'll be a return customer. Thanks!
I've eaten here a few times, and they have good pizza, but the people aren't very friendly, they saw us as an inconvenience, not customers

name: Subway
address: 512 W Sioux Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: As a person named Jared I have a certain love/hate relationship with subway.  It's never a bad place to get a sandwich, but I have to keep my association with them to a minimum.
It's a subway but the facility felt dirty. I also happened to find a hair from the beard of one of the employees who did have a hat but nothing over his beard.

I asked for a big mac and they gave me a salad. I began to speak to the manager, but he proceeded to cut me off and offered me wheat bread. I distinctly asked for a jitterbugger and was given whole milk. 1/5 stars from me.
It was great! I should have a meal there every day!
Clean place & friendly, prompt service.

name: Cattleman's Club Steakhouse
address: 29608 SD-34, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Arrived at 5pm. Waited in line to get in. Seated our large group (20+) right away.  Great beer and liquor selection. Service was great. I guess the only criticism I can come up with was a couple steals were slightly over. My medium rare was a full medium. On the pricey side but I really loved it.

Super good!  So glad I made it here and hope to make it back again and again.  The food was delicious and service was excellent!  This would be my regular spot without a doubt.  This is my first visit to Pierre and now I have to be sure to get back here so I can have dinner at Cattleman's!!!

Traveling through town, a local recommended it and we were not disappointed. Good selection of craft beers. On the way out we meet the owner and she recommended to restaurants in the area that we would like.  The atmosphere was casual and laid-back, we were in town for bird hunting and about half of the people we're dressed similarly. Know for steak, and it was good, as were the other items our group ordered.
Good was amazing! Service wonderful. Cost not bad at all!

Cattleman's Club is among the best steakhouses I've ever been to. That's not a claim that I make lightly as I've eaten in great restaurants all over the world. Every time I am in the area I go to the Cattleman's Club because the steak is always cooked to perfection.

name: Silver Spur
address: 103 E Main Ave, Fort Pierre, SD 57532, USA
reviews: We went to the Spur for the first time a few months ago and it was fantastic! Service was great, food was great, and we loved the atmosphere. We ended up return a month or two after that and again it lived up to the expectations that we had in place based off of our first time there. Since Pub 34 closed, this is one of the best places to go here in town!

This was our first experience eating there. We have heard great things and for our date night we wanted to try something new.  We got a great seat outside. Our Server Cari was quick, nice, friendly, and extremely helpful with helping us choose apps and our main course. Her suggestions were on point and did not disappoint at all. We ended up choosing two apps and 3 main dishes as everything looked amazing. The Totchos, Cheese curds for apps and the main courses Chicken Fried Steak, Southwest Cheesesteak, and the Grilled Gound were amazing as well as their aoli sauce were delicious. Trust me, they did not disappoint.. prices were great and portions were more than enough. Great drinks, amazing food, and great service. I highly recommend. Especially for a date night or family night out. Huge shout out to our server Cari, we will definitely go back because of her.
One of the best "not on the interstate" restaurants, I parked my semi and walked a half mile to dine there.would do that anytime.

Had great food and a great atmosphere. We were shooting darts for league and they were super amazing and able to reserve a few tables for the teams. Again, great food and would love coming back again.
Staff was friendly and the food was good! Atmosphere you would expect from a nice small town bar

name: Champs Chicken
address: 310 W 1st Ave, Fort Pierre, SD 57532, USA
reviews: Decent food and the staff is fun and friendly

name: Grey Goose Store and Social Club
address: 28886 Merry Rd, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: This place will always have a place in my heart. My Grandfather Vernon always came to The Goose for breakfast, when he grew less mobile the staff would deliver his breakfast to him every morning since he lived a few houses down. He loved this place and I love how they always looked out for him. Now that my grandfather has been gone 4 years this place will always be remembered.
Friendly, very nice inside, clean, great food and drinks and nice patios.

The food is pretty good, but the service is often sub-par to poor.  We waited more than an hour and forty-five minutes for our food, and the place wasn't even that busy! Our waiter assured us that the kitchen was working on our meal after about an hour of waiting.  It turns out that he was being dishonest and actually never even put in our order.  He started avoiding our table.  Only after another server noticed our frustration and took it upon herself to check on our order did our server admit that he had neglected to put in our order at all.  Baffling. Honestly, the food ended up being good, but overall, it was a vexing ordeal, and the whole meal should have been comped. This is our second negative experience here.

I live near by..a great place to eat.an the bar..u meet all walks of life..folks from every where..an from pierre.ft.pierre..just a Beautiful place to go an be happy..the store reasonable prices..stop by..see many hunters..bikers..an natives..hope to see u..
Very good breakfast! Courteous staff, small town pricing.

name: Scooter's Coffee
address: 401 E Sioux Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews:
One of my favorite places for coffee in town,  conveniently open later so I can get my Peanut Butter Blender w/2 extra shots to finish out the night 😄.
 I've visited many times, and have never seen there crew slacking. Good job guys/gals!

The first couple months the place was good and fairly fast. 

The last few times if there are 3 cars in front of you, prepare to wait minimum 15 minutes for a cup of coffee. 

Each day you can drive by and see the difference in service. On top of that, the $6 drink wasn't even that good in taste.
Decent food and coffee, waited in line for 15 minutes. I do not recommend if you are going for something quick.
First time eating a Breakfast Bagel. Real good!
WOW... GODS 🤤😱🤯🎅🏿

name: Lake Oahe
address: Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Some of the best fish in the state!

name: Spring Creek Resort and Marina
address: 28229 E Spring Creek Pl, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Food very good. Haven't been here for several years when under different management. Was very pleasantly surprised.

Excellent place for a get away!  Stopped in passing through for work and was able to put together a last minute fishing trip.  Limited out on Walleye and they grilled it for us that night.  Excellent!
Shelly is a wonderful server! Food is great!
Super place ☺️🚫stress ♥️👍
Excellent food. Great atmosphere.

name: Medicine Creek Bar & Grill LLC
address: 211 Pierre St, Blunt, SD 57522, USA
reviews: Best food and NOT overpriced!!! Love it, love them, always service with a smile. 😊
Cool
Great people and friendly staff.
Slow service. Miss lead on menu
Great place to eat. Low prices

name: Burger King
address: 201 W Sioux Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: They forgot 2 out of a simple 4 crescent order. I use to work fast food 9mo pregnant; in a area 30min outside Chicago; and could take, make, and expedite without mistakes. So not sure how hard you have to try to forget 2, exactly the same items, out of 4 especially when it's your special. They did send 2 free crescent coupons (it was that or drive back) but still didn't help that morning's breakfast.

Gotta say one of the dirtier burger kings I’ve been in. I usually enjoy a spicy chicken sandwich and fries but the fries were covered in black burnt specs so they tasted burnt while being soggy and undercooked. The place had trash all over it (including a used Kleenex on the cash register). My daughter said the toilet seat was sticky and they obviously haven’t deep cleaned anything in a long time. It’s obviously time for some training , take pride in your establishment.

Cant even make a sandwich with just bread patty and sauce. I got my sandwich soaked in sauce like it was completely dunked into a bowl of sauce. But they left the lettuce off like I requested. They even gave me medium fry when i ordered small
Just ordered a Texan Double Whopper and on the bottom bun of the burger there is some mold. Never puked so hard in my life hahah.

Everything was amazing. I was on a short lunch break from work going to a training for volunteer fire department, and the wait time was reasonable for the noon hour. I was able to get in and out, order exactly what I wanted and received it very fast. Would definitely recommend.

name: Hardee's
address: 305 W Sioux Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: The foods ok. They need to put a bit more effort into the food served. Take pride in your work.
Great food. Service was slow. The window gal didnt greet me or say the amount owed. Just took my money and handed me food. No thank you or have a nice day.

Very dissatisfied with the "service" we received. If you're in customer service, then it is obvious that being rude or curt is not what invites repeat business. The guy at the window clearly felt that his time was being wasted by the tone of his voice. Once we pulled up to the window, he could be heard yelling at another employee. No name badge. None on the receipt either. We were charged for adding bacon & did not get it on the burger. Never been to a Hardee's before & don't plan on returning.
I love their big chicken sandwich with a seeded bun!
Great fast food stop. The staff was super friendly, the food was served to our table with a smile and looked delicious. Highly recommend.

name: McDonald's
address: 610 W Sioux Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: The manager on duty tonight was very rude. I order a chocolate shake and he give me one mix with the shamrock. I ask if I can get another one remade and he said no it what I order so I showed him my receipt and he walked off. Tim the cashier was so nice as to take over and help. He was nice and friendly from the moment I walk in. The manager didn’t even have a name tag on and I think that because he knows that he has a poor attitude and awful customer service.

Really wish there was a way to give a negative. The dip ships have done it again! Went through the drive thru ordered a "bacon" quarter pounder ended up with a regular one. I'm really starting to believe they're still open cause they are the only one in town. How is it a promo that its being hyped and suggested can't be done correctly. I'm starting to think I'll save my McDonalds money for any not in Pierre, SD. Oh and as if messing up my order wasn't enough they forgot the bacon on my husband's too. (Funny part is they got the special request correct but couldn't remember the bacon.)

I tried to buy my grandson in Pierre some food but I am 160 miles away. I ordered on app and paid with my card but they wouldn’t let him pick it up because he didn’t have my phone. I even called them and explained but they said “Nope!” I canceled it and I’ll buy him food from elsewhere. No customer service there at Pierre McDonalds!

This McDonald's location has continued to ruin my view of them every time I go here. The staff is rude and the food is almost always cold.
There was one particular night where I went through the drive through with my fiance after a particularly long and hard day. The kid taking our order gave us the total and then told us to come up to the first window. We did and no one was there, so we pulled up to the second window. The staff was rude and said we should have gone to the first, so we explained that no one was there and they rolled their eyes. They only then proceeded to tell us that the ice cream machine was "broken" and they couldn't make the one thing I ordered: a vanilla shake. Why didn't they tell us when we ordered? I had already had a hard day, so I didn't respond and just drove off.

If this wasn't the only McDonald's I'd stop going. It seems like every other time I go they mess up my order especially through the drive thru. Paid for a bacon Big Mac no pickles got a regular Big Mac with the pickles. I give up and figure just expect them to screw it up.

name: Arby's
address: 319 W Sioux Ave, Pierre, SD 57501, USA
reviews: Had the half pound classic with a mint shake. So good

They do not go by the hours posted! 9:50pm on a Friday says the close at 11pm but yet the lady at the window said they were closed. I informed her of the hours posted and she could care less. It was closed 10 min early if it were a regular weekend (again as posted). 1hr and 10min is truly unacceptable!
Yoo the chicken sliders are absolute 🔥! If you're having a had day, just go to Arbys and get yourself a slider or two. It will not dissapoint.
Needs improving more. DAMN
This is Pierre's Arby's idea of sliced roast beef. WTF
